CA Notes: CalFresh BBCE eliminates asset test; AB 1811 (2018)
Asset values not required for CalFresh under BBCE
Asset verification not required for CalFresh under BBCE
CalFresh: not applicable under BBCE. Medi-Cal Non-MAGI: $130,000/person + $65,000/additional household member (effective 2024, codified for 2026+).
CalFresh: always true under BBCE. CalWORKs: $12,137 / $18,206 elderly-disabled (adjusted annually). Vehicle equity limit: $33,499.
CalFresh uses 200% FPL gross income threshold under BBCE versus federal 130% gross / 100% net
CalFresh: 200% FPL gross income test only under BBCE; no net income test
BBCE removes categorical ineligibility for lottery/gambling winnings in CalFresh
Follows substantialLotteryWinnings removal under BBCE
County-specific ABAWD time-limit waivers available in qualifying areas

Medi-Cal covers all income-eligible adults regardless of immigration status (state-funded). Full-scope Medi-Cal for undocumented adults effective 2024. CAPI: non-citizens ineligible for SSI. CFAP: qualified aliens ineligible for federal SNAP.
Medi-Cal (MAGI): 138% FPL adults, 213% FPL pregnant, 266% FPL children. No separate CHIP — children covered under Medi-Cal. State-funded coverage regardless of immigration status.
CA is a 1634 state: SSI/SSP recipients receive automatic Medi-Cal enrollment
Medi-Cal Non-MAGI: 30-month look-back for asset transfers (vs federal 60-month). CA chose shorter look-back period.
Medi-Cal Working Disabled Program: 250% FPL for working individuals with disabilities
Must demonstrate current employment for Working Disabled Buy-In eligibility
Medically needy spend-down amount; person must incur medical expenses above this threshold each month
CA calls this Share of Cost; functionally equivalent to federal medically needy spend-down
CalWORKs 48-month state time limit (vs 60-month federal). Safety Net: children continue cash aid after adult times out. Cal-Learn mandatory for pregnant/parenting teens.
CalWORKs good cause exemption includes domestic violence per Family Violence Option
$33,499 vehicle equity exemption (adjusted annually). Vehicles with equity above this limit counted as resources.
State Supplementary Payment amount; varies by living arrangement. CA is a 1616(a) state — CDSS sets SSP amounts but SSA makes combined SSI/SSP payment.
Determines SSP payment amount; independent living receives highest supplement
CA LIHEAP uses 60% state median income as income threshold; year-round operation (no seasonal restriction)
Heat/eat: minimal CA LIHEAP benefit confers CalFresh Standard Utility Allowance (SUA) eligibility
Aged/blind/disabled non-citizens ineligible for SSI due to immigration status. State-funded SSI/SSP analog. Resource limit $2,000/$3,000.
Legal immigrants ineligible for federal SNAP. Follows CalFresh BBCE rules (200% FPL gross; no asset test).
County-funded last-resort cash for indigent adults ineligible for other programs. Highly variable by county.
Required for all state-only programs; CAPI requires age 65+ or blind/disabled
Required for all state-only programs
Must meet SSA disability criteria for CAPI if not aged 65+
Must meet SSA blindness definition for CAPI blind pathway
Income type required for all state-only programs
Income verification required for all state-only programs
California 58 counties each administer benefits; county code identifies administering office
California Statewide Automated Welfare System case tracking number
Verification of California residency required for all state-administered programs
California Statewide Automated Welfare System client identifier
Determines benefit package and funding source (federal vs state-funded). Over 200 aid codes in use.
Added armenian|farsi|hmong|cambodian|thai|japanese for California language communities per Dymally-Alatorre Bilingual Services Act
